org.pipservices.runtime

Class ComponentSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pipservices.runtime.ComponentSet

  • public class ComponentSet
extends Object
    A list with references to all microservice components. It is capable of searching and retrieving components by specified criteria.
    Since:
    2016-06-09
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Sergey Seroukhov

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ComponentSet()
      Creates an empty component list
      ComponentSet(IComponent[] components)
      Creates a component list and fills with component references from component array.
      ComponentSet(List<? extends IComponent> components)
      Creates a component list and fills with component references from another list.

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Adds multiple components to the list

      Creates a component list from components passed as params

      Gets a sublist of component references from specific category.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(IComponent component)
        Adds a single component to the list
        Parameters:
        component - a component to be added to the list

      • addAll

        public void addAll(List<? extends IComponent> components)
        Adds multiple components to the list
        Parameters:
        components - a list of components to be added.

      • getAllByCategory

        public List<IComponent> getAllByCategory(String category)
        Gets a sublist of component references from specific category.
        Parameters:
        category - a category to pick components.
        Returns:
        a list of found components

      • getAllUnordered

        public List<IComponent> getAllUnordered()
        Get a list of components in random order. Since it doesn't perform additional calculations this operation is faster then getting ordered list.
        Returns:
        an unsorted list of components.

      • getAllOrdered

        public List<IComponent> getAllOrdered()
        Gets a list with all component references sorted in strict initialization order: Discovery, Logs, Counters, Cache, Persistence, Controller, ... This sorting order it require to lifecycle management to proper sequencing.
        Returns:
        a sorted list of components

      • getAllOptional

        public List<IComponent> getAllOptional(ComponentDescriptor descriptor)
        Finds all components that match specified descriptor. The descriptor is used to specify number of search criteria or their combinations:
        • By category
        • By logical group
        • By functional type
        • By implementation version
        Parameters:
        descriptor - a component descriptor as a search criteria
        Returns:
        a list with found components

      • getOneOptional

        public IComponent getOneOptional(ComponentDescriptor descriptor)
        Finds the a single component instance (the first one) that matches to the specified descriptor. The descriptor is used to specify number of search criteria or their combinations:
        • By category
        • By logical group
        • By functional type
        • By implementation version
        Parameters:
        descriptor - a component descriptor as a search criteria
        Returns:
        a found component instance or null if nothing was found.

      • getAllRequired

        public List<IComponent> getAllRequired(ComponentDescriptor descriptor)
                                throws MicroserviceError
        Gets all components that match specified descriptor. If no components found it throws a configuration error. The descriptor is used to specify number of search criteria or their combinations:
        • By category
        • By logical group
        • By functional type
        • By implementation version
        Parameters:
        descriptor - a component descriptor as a search criteria
        Returns:
        a list with found components
        Throws:
        MicroserviceError - when no components found

      • getOneRequired

        public IComponent getOneRequired(ComponentDescriptor descriptor)
                          throws MicroserviceError
        Gets a component instance that matches the specified descriptor. If nothing is found it throws a configuration error. The descriptor is used to specify number of search criteria or their combinations:
        • By category
        • By logical group
        • By functional type
        • By implementation version
        Parameters:
        descriptor - a component descriptor as a search criteria
        Returns:
        a found component instance
        Throws:
        MicroserviceError - when no components found

      • getOnePrior

        public IComponent getOnePrior(IComponent component,
                              ComponentDescriptor descriptor)
                       throws MicroserviceError
        Gets a component instance that matches the specified descriptor defined before specified instance. If nothing is found it throws a configuration error. This method is used primarily to find dependencies between business logic components in their logical chain. The sequence goes in order as components were configured. The descriptor is used to specify number of search criteria or their combinations:
        • By category
        • By logical group
        • By functional type
        • By implementation version
        For instance, quite often the descriptor will look as "logic / group / * / *"
        Parameters:
        component - a component that searches for prior dependencies
        descriptor - a component descriptor as a search criteria
        Returns:
        a found component instance
        Throws:
        MicroserviceError - when no components found

      • fromComponents

        public static ComponentSet fromComponents(IComponent... components)
        Creates a component list from components passed as params
        Parameters:
        components - a list of components
        Returns:
        constructed component set
